page.title: 01Review of Cwmfelinfach
page.content: {1Cwmfelinfach}is a village situated in the U shaped{River Sirhowy}valley.It grew as a mining village when{Nine {Mile Point colliery}was sunk in 1905. The main attraction is recently tele- vised{Babell Chapel}now a museum.The houses are typically terraced for a Welsh valley.Community meeting places are the chapels,school and local clubs.{Pioneer Hotel and the Institute are the largest buildings.We have a new factory site built over the old colliery,but most people work outside the village.Shopping is done mainly outside the area as there are few shops.the surrounding countryside is very beautiful of woodland,forestry and mountain moorland.Leisure areas include a football pitch,mini rugby pitch,a small park and children's welfare.{Islwyn Council}are planning a {Countryside centre}environmental study
